1.text: For this reason I, Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus for the sake of you Gentiles...

2.text: Surely you have heard about the stewardship of God’s grace that was given to me for you,

3.text: that is, the mystery made known to me by revelation, as I have already written briefly.

4.text: In reading this, then, you will be able to understand my insight into the mystery of Christ,

5.text: which was not made known to men in other generations as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to God’s holy apostles and prophets.

6.text: This mystery is that through the gospel the Gentiles are fellow heirs, fellow members of the body, and fellow partakers of the promise in Christ Jesus.

7.text: I became a servant of this gospel by the gift of God’s grace, given me through the working of His power.

8.text: Though I am less than the least of all the saints, this grace was given me: to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,

9.text: and to illuminate for everyone the stewardship of this mystery, which for ages past was kept hidden in God, who created all things.

10.text: His purpose was that now, through the church, the manifold wisdom of God should be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly realms,

11.text: according to the eternal purpose that He accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord.

12.text: In Him and through faith in Him we may enter God’s presence with boldness and confidence.

13.text: So I ask you not to be discouraged because of my sufferings for you, which are your glory.

14.text: ... for this reason I bow my knees before the Father,

15.text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth derives its name.

16.text: I ask that out of the riches of His glory He may strengthen you with power through His Spirit in your inner being,

17.text: so that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith. Then you, being rooted and grounded in love,

18.text: will have power, together with all the saints, to comprehend the length and width and height and depth

19.text: of the love of Christ, and to know this love that surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

20.text: Now to Him who is able to do immeasurably more than all we ask or imagine, according to His power that is at work within us,

21.text: to Him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus throughout all generations, forever and ever. Amen.
